alert.note: Alert for Santa Barbara County Central Coast Beaches; Santa Barbara County Inland Central Coast; Santa Barbara County Southwestern Coast; Santa Ynez Mountains Western Range; Santa Ynez Valley (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 24 at 12:15PM PST by NWS Oxnard
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Santa Barbara County through 1245 PM PST... At 1214 PM PST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Lompoc to near Point Conception. Movement was northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and pea size hail. A weak tornado briefly possible. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Lompoc... Point Conception... Solvang... Los Alamos... Highway 101 through Gaviota State Park... Buellton... and Mission Hills. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
